content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had a conversation with Max Müller from Germany.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price for an apartment in Magdeburg.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Yes
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price. Max Müller was willing to pay up to €700 per month, but I was not willing to accept less than €800 per month. As a result, Max Müller decided to consider other options.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: If we had agreed on a final price, the final price would have been €800 per month. However, since Max Müller was only willing to pay up to €700 per month and I was not willing to accept less than €800 per month, we did not reach a mutual agreement.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: As Peter Schmidt, I would rate Max Müller's likeability as a negotiation partner as a 5 out of 10. While Max seemed smart and responsible, his insistence on paying below market value for the apartment made the negotiation difficult. His stance on the price, despite being informed of the property's value, left me with the impression that he was not willing to meet the fair price for the apartment.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation. Max Müller's approach was straightforward, and while we did not reach an agreement, I did not perceive any personal affront.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator
